name: REDCapPRO
description:
Patient Reported Outcomes in REDCap
This module provides a means of identifying and authenticating study participants when collecting survey data. It stores that information in the REDCap project's audit trail.
See full documentation here.

system-settings.name:
Email From Address:
This will be the From email address for all system emails. This can help if emails are being sent to spam or are not delivered (default is noreply@REDCapPRO.com)

Prevent Email Login:
Should participants be prevented from using their email address to log in to the system. Checking this will require that they login using their participant username only.
Note: if checked, this overrides the associated project-level setting

Warning Time:
Number of minutes to wait before warning participant of inactivity timeout (default is 1 minute)

Timeout Time:
Number of minutes to wait before logging participant out due to inactivity (default is 5 minutes)

Password Length:
Minimum length of password (default is 8 characters)

Login Attempts:
Number of failed login attempts before being locked out (default is 3 attempts)

Lockout Duration:
Length of a lockout due to failed login attempts, in seconds (default is 300 seconds)

Multi-Factor Authentication:
Should participants be required to use multi-factor authentication (MFA) when logging in? If so, they will be required to enter a code sent to their email address after entering their username and password. This is an additional security measure to prevent unauthorized access.
Note: this setting enables the MFA option globally, but it still must be enabled in the project settings to take effect

Self-Registration and Enrollment Settings

These settings control the ability for participants to register and/or enroll themselves. Please take care to understand the implications of this before enabling it in the system.

Allow Self-Registration:

Should participants be allowed to create their own accounts? (default is No)
Note: this must also be enabled in a project's settings to take effect

Restrict Self-Registration project settings to REDCap administrators:
Should only REDCap administrators be able to enable/disable the API in project settings? If not, any REDCapPRO manager in the project will be able to enable/disable participant self-registration and/or enrollment in project settings.
Note: this setting only applies if participant self-registration is enabled globally

Allow Auto-Enroll Upon Self-Registration:

Should participants be automatically enrolled in the project upon self-registration? (default is No)
Note: this must also be enabled in a project's settings to take effect

reCAPTCHA Site Key:

Site key for reCAPTCHA v2 (default is empty)
It is fine to use the same value as the REDCap site key (found on Modules/Services Configuration page)

reCAPTCHA Secret Key:

Secret key for reCAPTCHA v2 (default is empty)
It is fine to use the same value as the REDCap secret key (found on Modules/Services Configuration page)
